history.content: You should write the statement. The form says they'll take a look at the Statement of Purpose in case you miss the cutoff. If you're a little iffy about whether you'll make it (like I am rn lol), then it's better to write one anyway – at least you'll be demonstrating interest! Good luck though :)

Yes, I even updated the text to show the importance of this. EVERYONE should complete this part. If you do not receive a 3.30 GPA we will not be looking at an appeal or email, we will be looking at this part of your application.

children.subject: Did you receive a confirmation email when you submitted. If so, you're fine. If not, resubmit
is there a technical issue? should I resubmit my app? I filled it early because I was afraid I would forget.

history.content: I'll be submitting the CS Major Petition form after this Friday (because it has technical issues now AFAIK). If I'm not sure whether I'll earn a 3.3 GPA or not this semester, should I fill out the optional section of the form called "Statement of Purpose" just in case? Or should I submit an appeal later, in the event I do not earn a 3.3
history.subject: Declaring CS: Statement of Purpose section
